content.html:
There’s a whole separate system for replies to webmentions here in micro.blog that I think you can set up similarly with [alltogethernow.io](https://alltogethernow.io) where there’s a timeline and everything.


You may not be able to see the reply link or getting notifications from the non-publicized reply page. 🤔

content.html:
Via@feditips@mstdn.social

—-

If you like to share photos you might want to check out @pixelfed, an Instagram-style photo sharing network on the Fediverse.

You can find out more and sign up at:

pixelfed.org

PixelFed uses the same federation protocol as Mastodon, which means Mastodon users can follow people on PixelFed and vice versa. You can try following a PixelFed account right now such as @Iancylkowski or @JoseMel or @connyduck

You can use PixelFed through a web browser, and there are also free open Android apps like @PixelDroid and FediLab (@apps).

#Fediverse #FediTips #Instagram #Alternatives #PixelFed

You can use PixelFed through a web browser, and there are also free open Android apps like @PixelDroid and FediLab (@apps).

content.html:
Been trying so hard to get Go Blog running for the last 6 hours but my command of Docker being nil along with the lack of sleep from having to be on call for the day job since 5am today has got me table flippin' hot right now.

(╯ರ ~ ರ）╯︵ ┻━┻ Take that! (ノʘ言ʘ)ﾉ ⌒┫ ┻ ┣ ┳☆(>｡☆)

That’s what I get really…

Like I said, the holy grail is to have a site set up that does ActivityWeb and WebMentions/Microformats.

And I’ll be right back at it again tomorrow I guess.

–goodnight from ATL.
content.value:
Some dude flipping a whole table full of shit the fuck over because he's frustrated as fuck, just like I am right now!

(╯ರ ~ ರ）╯︵ ┻━┻ Take that! (ノʘ言ʘ)ﾉ ⌒┫ ┻ ┣ ┳☆(>｡☆)
That’s what I get really…
Like I said, the holy grail is to have a site set up that does ActivityWeb and WebMentions/Microformats.
And I’ll be right back at it again tomorrow I guess.
 pinky and the brain 
–goodnight from ATL.

content.html:
In reply to hacdias.com/2022/12/2…

… my own website doesn’t support certain functionalities, such as following others.

I think it’s possible to just use an RSS reader and do it from there… or tie it together with BridgyFed I think.

I’m after the same holy grail of “one website to do all the things” so that’s why I’m looking at GoBlog.

Any tips you have on set up and running are very welcome and appreciated 🙇🏾‍♂️

content.html:
In reply to hacdias.com/2022/12/2…

I completely understand; I’ll probably become a “404” comment too after my time with micro.blog is up (unless there’s a way to make a 301 Moved note somewhere)

But I still believe in preserving for posterity. I have entire tweets replies that have been locked and deleted– saving comments to your blog keeps that ephemerality from spreading and you can at the very least see where the discussion went, even if the people who typed those words have moved on to some other digital domain.
content.value:

content.html:
🤔✍🏾 I’ve got an impending blog post expounding on this subject “coming soon™”

It’s important to note:

Mastodon =/= Fediverse; Fediverse == #Mastodon, #Pixelfed, #Write.as, #Micro.blog, #Pleroma, #Peertube, #Lemmy etc.

There’s a whole breadth of components that plug into this ecosystem and each one has its own strengths and weaknesses. Its pretty easy to imagine journalists using more than one tool that can get the job done
– @starrwulfe@public.garden

starrwulfe https://public.garden/objects/9f3ae8d3-638d-4279-98b4-50bf019c97c8
